[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/constants.move] [Precision: Time] [Seconds Per Year] Can accumulated precision loss from using 31,536,000 seconds per year cause interest calculations to drift by thousands of dollars on large positions over years? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/constants.move] [Precision: Percentages] [Small Amounts] For amounts smaller than percentage_benchmark()==10000, can percentage calculations always round to zero? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/constants.move] [Precision: Basis Points] [Sub-Basis Point] Can the protocol represent fees smaller than 1 basis point (0.01%), or does percentage_benchmark()==10000 limit precision? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/constants.move] [Option Type: Supply] [Incentive Double Claim] Can an attacker call supply operations multiple times with option_type_supply()==1 to claim incentives repeatedly for the same supply? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/constants.move] [Option Type: Withdraw] [Premature Withdrawal] Can option_type_withdraw()==2 bypass lock-up periods if the option type check is separate from time-lock validation? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/constants.move] [Option Type: Borrow] [Collateral Bypass] Can borrowers use option_type_borrow()==3 without posting sufficient collateral if option type validation is decoupled from collateral checks? (Critical)
